body_content.explanation: continuing in one direction without bending or curving:
examples: a straight line
She has straight blonde hair.
Skirts this summer are long and straight.
Can't you see it? - it's straight ahead (of you)!
The dog seemed to be coming straight at/for me.
Go straight along this road and turn left at the traffic lights.

body_content.explanation: honest:
examples: Just be straight with her and tell her how you feel.
Tell me straight, would you rather we didn't go tonight?

body_content.explanation: If you tell someone something straight out, you say it directly and honestly, without trying to make what you are saying more pleasant:
examples: I told her straight out that I didn't love her any more.

body_content.explanation: immediately:
examples: I got home and went straight to bed.
We'll go straight to the party after dinner.
Time is short so I'll get straight to the point (= explain the matter immediately).

body_content.explanation: clearly:
examples: You know you've had too much to drink when you can't see straight.
I'm so tired I can't think straight any more.

body_content.explanation: immediately:
examples: I knew straight away what you were thinking.

body_content.explanation: clear or not complicated:
examples: It's a straight choice - either you leave him or you stay.
Let's get this straight - you're travelling to Frankfurt on Monday and Brussels on Tuesday, is that correct?

body_content.explanation: level and not sloping to either side:
examples: This picture's not straight.
The shelf isn't straight - it sags in the middle.

body_content.explanation: plain and basic, or without anything added:
examples: No tonic for me, please, I like my vodka straight.
Straight pasta is very bland - you need some kind of sauce to make it interesting.

body_content.explanation: following one after another without an interruption:
examples: They're the only team to have won ten straight games this season.

body_content.explanation: tidy, or arranged in order:
examples: It only took an hour to get the flat straight after the party.
Do you have a mirror? - I'll just put my hair straight.

body_content.explanation: traditional or serious:
examples: He was a nice enough guy, but he was so straight - I always felt I had to be on my best behaviour with him.
There's a lot of straight theatre at the festival as well as the newer, more experimental stuff.

body_content.explanation: sexually or romantically attracted to men if you are a woman, and to women if you are a man:
examples: I was thirteen when I first suspected that I wasn't straight.

body_content.explanation: involving or relating to women who are sexually or romantically attracted to men, or men who are sexually or romantically attracted to women:
examples: She ended her straight marriage and came out as a lesbian.

body_content.explanation: not using illegal drugs or alcohol:
examples: He's been straight for five months.

body_content.explanation: neither owing nor owed any money:
examples: You bought the tickets, so if I pay for the taxi, we'll be straight.

body_content.explanation: the straight part of a racetrack (= the track on which competitors race):
examples: And the runners are just coming up to the finishing straight.

body_content.explanation: with a series of hits, throws, or kicks of the ball or a series of actions that produce a perfect score in a game or competition:
examples: I beat him in the final in straights.

body_content.explanation: in the card game poker, five cards which follow each other in order but are not of the same suit (= colour and type):
examples: You want five low cards, no pairs, no straights, no flushes, and the lowest hand wins.
When the pocket cards were shown, both players had identical straights.

body_content.explanation: a person who is not gay
